intro: Myobroma pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered myobroma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Myobroma pubiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats within rainforests.
